news.title: Ashiana Housing posts net profit of ₹56.65 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Ashiana Housing's net profit surged to ₹56.65 crore for the quarter ending December 31, 2025 from ₹10.85 crore in the same period last year. Total income also saw a substantial jump to ₹373.35 crore during the said quarter.

news.title: Arvind SmartSpaces' net profit falls 41.79% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Arvind SmartSpaces saw its net profit drop by over 41% in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Total income also decreased compared to the previous year. The company announced leadership changes with Priyansh Kapoor becoming managing director and CEO.

news.title: Sonu Sood lease out commercial space to HDFC Bank for monthly rent of ₹11.75 lakh
news.para: Sonu Sood has signed a nine-year lease agreement with HDFC Bank for a commercial property in Trade Centre BKC, Mumbai. This deal begins with a monthly rental rate of ₹11.75 lakh, set to escalate by 15% every three years. The 2,700 sq ft unit, which Sood acquired in 2012, also offers parking facilities.

news.title: Turner International leases 46,000 sq ft workspace from WeWork India in Navi Mumbai
news.para: Turner International India has secured a large managed office space from WeWork India in Navi Mumbai. This new facility will accommodate over 650 employees.  WeWork India has expanded its capacity by 20,000 desks in the last year.

news.title: Wanted accused in Shine City fraud case held in Lucknow
news.para: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has arrested Nekpal Singh alias Nikki, a wanted accused in the multi-crore Shine City Infra Project Private Limited fraud case. Singh allegedly misled investors at the company's Lucknow office, promising to double their funds, before absconding. The EOW took him into custody from the Krishna Nagar police station area.

news.title: Nagpur: 55km phase-III to be metro’s longest expansion
news.para: Nagpur Metro's ambitious Phase 3 will add 54.5 km, including a significant 25 km stretch along the Inner Ring Road. This expansion, confirmed by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, aims to boost connectivity across the city and industrial areas. The project will also explore driverless Metro operations, potentially making it India's first fully automated corridor.

news.title: Three townships coming up in Himachal Pradesh, says minister
news.para: Himachal Pradesh is set to launch ambitious urban development projects, including new townships in Baddi, Morni Hills, and near Kangra airport, to address housing demand and enhance public convenience. The state will also develop 919 residential units near Shimla, with a special quota for award winners. Policy reforms and commercial projects were also approved.

news.title: NHB pushes for lower home loan rates, lenders delay cuts till April
news.para: The National Housing Bank is pushing housing finance companies to lower lending rates for customers.  However, these companies plan to wait until April for their internal benchmarks to be reset before making significant rate cuts.  Some lenders have already made minor reductions.  This move aims to pass on reduced borrowing costs to existing borrowers.

news.title: Areion Group wins ₹936-crore bid for Aviom India Housing Finance
news.para: Areion Group secured the winning bid for Aviom India Housing Finance. Secured lenders unanimously backed Areion's Rs 936-crore offer. This plan offers lenders a recovery of about 65%. Unity Small Finance Bank had placed a higher bid but with conditions. Lenders preferred Areion's unconditional offer for certainty of recovery.

news.title: Karnataka expands build limits for industrial plots
news.para: Karnataka has significantly increased built-up area allowances on industrial land, raising ground coverage from 65% to 75% and expanding Floor Area Ratio (FAR) options. This move aims to improve land utilization in KIADB areas and attract further investment by enabling greater vertical development and encouraging flatted factories.

news.title: Chandigarh administration plans to auction around 1,000 vacant government properties
news.para: Chandigarh administration plans to auction nearly 1,000 vacant government properties, including residential, commercial, and industrial sites, starting next fiscal year. This initiative aims to boost revenue by an estimated Rs 1,000 crore in the first two quarters and ensure optimal land utilization. E-auctions will be conducted monthly to prevent illegal occupation and support the real estate market.

news.title: NCLT clears Hotel Horizon resolution; NCLAT bars equity creation for now
news.para: The National Company Law Tribunal has approved the acquisition of Hotel Horizon by a consortium including Oberoi Realty. This follows the company's admission of liabilities. The successful bidder's plan offers a significant recovery for lenders. However, the NCLT order has been challenged at the NCLAT, which has put a stay on further actions pending its final ruling.

news.title: Mumbai civic body issues attachment notices for multi-crore property tax default
news.para: Mumbai's civic body has issued property attachment notices to major tax defaulters, including Raghuvanshi Mills Limited with over Rs 140 crore in arrears. The BMC warned of asset seizure and auction if outstanding dues are not cleared promptly. This action follows repeated reminders and aims to recover crucial revenue for civic services.

news.title: Confident Group assures project completion after chairman's suicide amid IT search
news.para: Confident Group assured customers that all ongoing projects will be completed on time. The MD stated an Income Tax inspection was routine and denied extreme harassment. The company fully cooperated with officials. Construction activities are funded through sales collections.

news.title: Shriram Properties acquires Shrivision Upscale Spaces
news.para: Shriram Properties has acquired full ownership of Shrivision Upscale Spaces. The deal was completed on February 9, 2026, for ₹10 per share. Shrivision Upscale Spaces is involved in real estate development. This strategic acquisition is for business purposes.

news.title: Bajaj Electricals' posts loss of ₹34.1 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: In the September quarter of FY26, Bajaj Electricals reported a net loss of Rs 34.10 crore, primarily due to slimmer gross margins and the implications of newly enacted labour laws. The company's operational revenue took a hit, declining by 18.5 percent overall. While revenue from Consumer Products saw a downturn, there was a notable increase in Lighting Solutions.

news.title: NGT issues notice to MCD, others over 'unauthorised' construction in Yamuna floodplain
news.para: The National Green Tribunal is probing allegations regarding unlawful construction on the floodplain of the Yamuna river. The issue emerged from a petition filed by a local resident, who claims that a high-rise building is under construction in the Majnu ka Tila vicinity.

news.title: The Ramco Cements'  net profit jumps two-fold to ₹385.63 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: The Ramco Cements Ltd announced a significant profit increase in the December quarter of FY26. Net profit more than doubled year-on-year, reaching Rs 385.63 crore. This surge was driven by improved cement prices and operational efficiencies. Revenue from operations also saw a healthy rise.
